title: The Global Environment
description: Interdisciplinary investigation of how human activities impact the Earth's environment on a global scale. Examination of population, resource use, climate change, and biodiversity from scientific/technical and social/economic/ historical/political perspectives. Use of remote sensing maps. Sustainable solutions. 4 lectures. Crosslisted as AG/EDES/ENGR/ HUM/SCM/UNIVÂ 350. Fulfills GE Area F.
prerequisites: Junior standing and completion of GE Areas A and B
